case_vignette: A 65-year-old man is brought to his primary care provider by his concerned wife. She reports he has had this "thing" on his eye for years and refuses to seek care. He denies any pain or discharge from the affected eye. A picture of his eye is shown below.
question: Given the diagnosis, what are you most likely to discover when taking this patient's history?
correct_ans: he grew up in ecuador, where he worked outdoors as a farmer for 30 years

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I don't have any pain or discharge from my eye, but my wife is concerned about a growth on it that's been there for years.
Has the growth on your eye changed in size, shape, or color recently?
No, it hasn't changed in size, shape, or color recently.
Is the growth located on the white part of your eye or on the eyelid?
The thing is on my eye, not on the eyelid.
Does anyone in your family have a history of eye conditions or skin cancer?
I'm not sure, we don't really talk about that kind of stuff.
Have you noticed any changes in your vision since you first observed the growth?
No, my vision has stayed the same.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you had any recent injuries to your eye?
No, I'm not on any medications and I haven't had any injuries to my eye.
How old are you, and what is your sex?
I am a 65-year-old man.
Final Diagnosis: Pinguecula
